The 'University of Leicester' ( ) is a research-led university based in
Leicester, England. The main campus is south of the city centre, adjacent to
Victoria Park.

The university has established itself as a leading research-led university and
has been named University of the Year of 2008 by the Times Higher Education. [http://www2.le.ac.uk/ebulletin/news/press-releases/2000-
2009/2008/10/nparticle.2008-10-24.3357348950 University of Leicester -
University of Leicester Named University of the Year ] The university has consistently ranked amongst the top 15 universities
in the United Kingdom by the Times Good University Guide and The Guardian; it
has a vision of becoming an established top ten UK university by 2015. The 2012 QS World University
Rankings also placed Leicester 8th in the UK for research citations. [http://www2.le.ac.uk/news/blog/2012/october/league-table-cites-
leicester-in-top-ten-for-research-citations League table cites Leicester in top
ten for research citations â University of Leicester ] The University is most famous for the invention of Genetic
Fingerprinting and for the discovery of the remains of King Richard III.
